intro: Fedia samolifolia, commonly known as the white-flowered fedia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Fedia samolifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
